properties.name: Brown Ledge Camp
properties.description: Posted by Mydogischelsea Brown Ledge CampWonderful, wonderful summer camp along the shores of Malletts Bay. I\'ve spent many a beautiful summer learning, teaching and growing at this place. This is where I learned how to sail, and this where I\'ve taught many other young women how to sail, too.

properties.name: Colorado College
properties.description: Posted by Mydogischelsea College!Best. Place. Ever. Why doesn\'t the whole world run on the block schedule?

properties.name: Hyde Park is the best thing about Chicago
properties.description: Posted by Mydogischelsea  Where I lived for four months during the Urban Studies ProgramHyde Park is by far one of the coolest place I\'ve ever lived. One day, I\'ll map out the famed Appetizer Tour—starting with the Calypso Cafe and ending with 40 ounces of malt liquor on Claire\'s porch. Claire, Ellie and I are truly brilliant eaters.

properties.name: I've been to Cuba—legally
properties.description: Posted by MydogischelseaHavana, CubaI travelled to Cuba the summer after my junior year of college via grants through my school. I went legally—really! I even have a very proud stamp in my passport—under the "Building People-to-People Ties" visa that Dubya has since eradicated. If you\'d like to more, I\'d love to tell you.

properties.name: Muddy's Coffeehouse
properties.description: Posted by Johndoe   3560 N Mississippi Ave, Portland, OR 97227http://wiki.personaltelco.net/index.cgi/Node641

properties.name: OH, oh, Santa Fe, you're wonderful but THIS APARTMENT COMPLEX SUCKS
properties.description: Posted by MydogischelseaThe San Mateo Douchey-Ass ApartmentsI liked Santa Fe. It was a good place to live for five months. It is, however, the last time I ever rent from a management company. Anyway, the faux adobe asthetic gets somewhat tiresome, but I miss my roommate. No one is cooler than D-lo.

properties.name: Saturday 3 pm, Buckman Field
properties.description: Posted by Mydogischelsea NE 12th Ave & Everett St.This game is HARDCORE—I\'ve never been, but from what I hear, these players are good. Not recommended for beginners (like me). Definitely recommended for people looking for a high-skilled game. Go ho or go home.

properties.name: Sunday 10:30 am, Peninsula Park
properties.description: Posted by Mydogischelsea  700 n portland blvd, portland, ORLaid-back, cleats optional, beginners welcome. We usually go out to breakfast at Muddy\'s afterwards. Because after playing frisbee in Portland, you\'re hungry and muddy.

properties.name: Sunday 3 pm, Buckman Field
properties.description: Posted by Mydogischelsea NE 10th Ave & Fremont St, portland ORThe skill level of this game varies by week—sometimes competitive, sometimes more casual. If this means anything to you, I\'VE played in this game and I\'ve only been playing for six months. Admittedly, I was the most inexperienced player out there, but no one seemed to hold it against me. NOTE! This is the old Irving game. It\'s moved to Buckman for the summer due to construction at Irving.

properties.name: The Naked Sheep Knit Shop
properties.description: Posted by Mydogischelsea 2142 N Killingsworth St, Portland, OR, 97217, United StatesA local yarn shop with a space as bright and colorful as its yarn selection. They have a million different classes and a little dog, too.

properties.name: The first year of my life
properties.description: Posted by Mydogischelseaholland park, London, EnglandI don\'t remember a thing about London, but I was born there. Learned to walk there, too, in a pick-your-own-strawberry patch. There\'s a picture of that first step somewhere. My father once argued that he took the picture; I proved him wrong when it turned out he was in it, too.

properties.name: We met in Brooklyn, we moved to Portland
properties.description: Posted by MydogischelseaI love North PortlandMaybe the craziest thing I have ever done is move to a new city with a boy I had known for only six months via long-distance phone conversations. Sometimes, though, when you have no idea what else to do, the crazy thing seems logical. Hey, eight months later, I stlll don\'t regret my decision.

properties.name: Where I grew up
properties.description: Posted by Mydogischelsea Where I grew upIt\'s changed quite a bit since I was a kid, but I still call it my home. I remember the days when the Upper West Side still had some character—and rent control kept it affordable.
